browser_factory

browser_factory.get_driver(browser_name, headless=False)

Initializes and returns a Selenium WebDriver instance based on the specified browser.

This function sets up a WebDriver instance for either Chrome, Firefox, or Edge, with options to run in headless mode. It uses the webdriver_manager package to automatically manage driver binaries.

Parameters:

  • browser_name (str) – The name of the browser to use (“chrome”, “firefox”, or “edge”).

  • headless (bool) – Optional; whether to run the browser in headless mode. Default is False.

Returns:

An instance of the Selenium WebDriver for the specified browser.

Return type:

selenium.webdriver

Raises:

ValueError – If the specified browser is not supported.
